thread.title: Austin Aztex will not play in 2016 season
thread.title_full: Austin Aztex will not play in 2016 season

title: Austin Aztex will not play in 2016 season
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Austin Aztex will not play in 2016 season The team confirmed it has been granted a one-year waiver by the United Soccer League "due to the unavailability of a stadium that meets league standards." Post to Facebook Austin Aztex will not play in 2016 season The team confirmed it has been granted a one-year waiver by the United Soccer League "due to the unavailability of a stadium that meets league standards." Check out this story on KVUE.com: http://kvue.tv/1L9gFti Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Austin Aztex will not play in 2016 season KVUE 4:03 p.m. CDT October 2, 2015 Austin Aztex CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
AUSTIN – The Austin Aztex confirmed Friday that the team has been granted permission to not participate in the 2016 season by the United Soccer League. 
In a statement released by the team, the Aztex will not play in 2016 “due to the unavailability of a stadium that meets league standards and the unforeseen delays in the development of a soccer-specific stadium in Austin.” 
The Aztex’s search for a new home was hindered when flooding damaged House Park in late May, forcing them to search for a suitable venue for the rest of their 2015 season. They played the remainder of their home games at Kelly Reeves Stadium, which is owned by Round Rock ISD. 
The USL granted the team a one-year waiver, and the Aztex said they plan to be back on the field in the 2017. 
According to the USL, the Aztex finished the 2015 season 10-15-3. Read or Share this story: http://kvue.tv/1L9gFti TOP VIDEOS
